titles.title: A bill to prohibit vessels transporting Alaskan oil from using routes through the territorial and international waters northward of the Santa Barbara Channel Islands.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.
Executive Comment Requested from Commerce, DOT, CEQ, Interior.
Referred to Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Navigation.
Unfavorable Executive Comment Received From DOT.
Unfavorable Executive Comment Received From Navy.

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Prohibits vessels transporting Alaskan oil to any port in California east or south of the Santa Barbara Channel Islands of San Miguel, Santa Rosa, Santa Cruz, and Anacapa from using any route passing through the territorial or international waters which lie between such islands and the coast of California. Sets forth penalties for violations of this Act.
